alert.note: Alert for Davidson; Forsyth (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 24 at 1:08AM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 230 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following counties, Davidson and Forsyth. * WHEN...Until 230 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 108 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. The heaviest rainfall has shift out of the area, but light to moderate rain is expected to continue for a few more hours. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Winston-Salem, Clemmons, Lewisville, Walkertown, Pfafftown, Stanleyville and Sedge Garden. - This includes the following flood prone locations... Bethania Station Rd at Bethabara Park Blvd, Reynolda Rd at Bethabara Park Blvd, S Main St at E Salem Ave, Hawthorne Rd at W 1st St, Northwest Blvd at Thurmond St, Phillips Bridge Rd at Muddy Creek, Indiana Ave at E 28th St, Waterworks Rd at Frazier Creek, University Pkwy at Coliseum Dr and Old Town Dr near Bethania Station Rd. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
